column4: guys, i've 1 server and how do i connect to it? in windows i ican connect to it using putty.exe... sshs connection... any application that does the same way in ubuntu?
type ssh
sorry i'm not sure how it works... do i have to type in ssh 192.168.254.13? the port is 22.
ssh 192.168.254.13 doesn't connect and no result shows
Sorry, afk.  ssh then the ip or DNS name should work.  If it's not, check are you running ssh daemon on different port than 22?
let me check on it.
thanks!
if i run ssh server.host.name... i'm getting Name or service not known
Can you ping the host?  You say you can get into this box in Putty alright?
yes. i can get into it using putty.exe
I'm afraid I'm not sure what the problem is then - Putty and ssh should be behaving the same!  Try a "ssh -v -v -v hostname" and see if the debug info gives you any more hints.
tripe -v?
Yes, it increases debug up to a max of three.
debug1: Reaing config data /etc/ssh/ssh_config debug1: Apllying options for * debug2: ssh_connect: needpriv 0
ssh glark.yaqoub.lan: Name or service not known
It's really not resolving that name.  You're sure a "ping hostname" from the same box - same shell - works?
Okay, try a ssh -v -v -v 192.168.254.13
just 1 last question? how do i log in? do i just type ssh? or ssh IPAddress? ssh hostname?
then i'll start from there
ssh will give you a username prompt unless you pass -lmyusername to it, it will prompt for a password unless you're using a certificate.  Get past that are you're in a shell.
and ssh will take either hostname or ip address - either is good.  Will ask you to confirm fingerprint on first connect.
